thread.title: Freight Volumes Weak Heading Into Busy Holiday Season
thread.title_full: Freight Volumes Weak Heading Into Busy Holiday Season

author: morningstar.com
title: Freight Volumes Weak Heading Into Busy Holiday Season
text:
By Brian Baskin
A measure of U.S. freight volumes hit its lowest level for September in at least three years, a sign that retailers sitting on high inventory levels may be curtailing orders ahead of the holiday season.
The Cass Freight Index, measuring domestic freight shipping, largely by rail and truck, fell 1.5% from a year ago last month, and below September readings going back to 2012, the earliest data provided by Cass Information Systems Inc. Volumes were up 1.7% from August, reflecting the seasonal increase in cargo transportation, which rises in the fall as retailers stock up for holiday shoppers.
Many retailers and manufacturers built up inventories around the start of the year, fearing that a labor-related slowdown at West Coast ports would drag on. But the ports have been operating normally for months, leaving companies with extra goods in their warehouses, and a reduced need to bring in more cargo by truck or rail.
CSX Corp., a railroad, said Wednesday it expects rail volumes to continue to fall through the end of the year, and trucking companies are also bracing for weak pricing as demand levels off.
However, some see freight volumes bouncing back as inventories decline toward the end of the year. The pace at which retailers and manufacturers run through stockpiles could increase if the Federal Reserve raises interest rates later this year, raising the cost of holding inventories, the Cass report said.
Write to Brian Baskin at brian.baskin@wsj.com
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
October 14, 2015 13:41 ET (17:41
